bibl.title: Despatch from Robert S. Newton to the Assistant Secretary of State
Despatches from United States Consuls in St Paul Loanda

div1.p:
United States Consulate
St. Paul de Loanda
3 May 1884.

I am advised of the non-payment of the two Bills No 7 $350 and No 8 for $174 drawn in my favor by Consul Du Verge on the Secretary of the Treasury on the ground that he was in a condition not responsible for his actions at the time of signing.
I beg to enclose copy of a despatch I find has been inserted in the Official Correspondence Book by Mr Du Verge advising the drawing of one of these bills.
These Bills were sent to me by Mr Du Verge from Banana in a letter of which I have the honor to transmit a copy.

While Mr Du Verge was in the Congo he ordered in his capacity as chief of the Station at Vivi, of the Belgians Association. Several articles which were charged to him and as it will be seen by the enclosed Copy of Account, there remained a Balance after payment of his Bills, which I did not for a moment doubt, due to him of £30:2:4 for which I remitted to him, by the packet of the 15th of last month
